channel.title: So.. At my school
channel.description:
Well today I went to school late because the highway had gotten backed up from a wreck; so I went to school 10 minutes late. When I arrived to the parking lot, the gates were locked, meaning I couldn't park my car, and besides that all the spots were full. So, I went to the other parking lot and the gates were also locked with full parking.
Now my question is, I paid $60.00 to be able to park AT the school. There are other places to park (not at the school) but I could get towed. Is this fair I paid, but can't park?

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

I’d consider yourself lucky you’re only paying $60 for the year, it’s about $200 here. Granted we have assigned parking spots.

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I resolved it with my principal. Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

first world problem, the school won’t care.

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

You probably had to sign something when you paid your for your permit, and if you didn’t you probably didn’t read what they said which probably says the gates are closed at ~ time and anything after is not their responsibility.

Even if you want to argue it, you will lose. With anything related to school the statement “if you had left earlier your problem would have been avoided”

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:6, topic:456505”]Davidi2: Your example doesn’t work, since it is not reasonable to lock him out for being 10 minute late. If you are 10 minute late in a movie theatre you might have missed something, but you are still allowed to see the rest of it.[/quote]I did specifically said he only missed one day, not ‘the rest of it’ as well?

A movie is 2 hours long, so missing 10 minutes is missing 1/12 of what you paid for. He missed one day out of however long he paid for, which if it was the whole school year is around 1/180 (or like 1/45 if it was for a quarter, etc)

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Davidi2: Your example doesn’t work, since it is not reasonable to lock him out for being 10 minute late. If you are 10 minute late in a movie theatre you might have missed something, but you are still allowed to see the rest of it.

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Similar to paying to visit movie online, if you arrive late you are going to miss part of the movie and no matter how much you beg they aren’t going to start over for you (no matter if it was your fault or not). You aren’t being repeatedly denied access, are you? If it was just this time and you were late, I don’t think it’s their fault at all. So you’re missing PART of what you paid for. (Whatever your daysofschool/60 is)

Read full topic

item.title: So.. At my school
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

It isn’t fair that your school are giving more permits out that they have parking lots.

Read full topic
